instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1286: What is A1286? A1286 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2009 , Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2255, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2330, 820-2532, 820-2523, 820-2533, 820-2850, 820-2915, 820-3330..
definitions.820-3330: What is 820-3330? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.KERNEL_TASK: What is KERNEL_TASK? KERNEL_TASK is a process that will take up all the CPU and cause the macbook to run very slow when there is a sensor issue. When you see KERNEL_TASK as a process taking up lots of CPU and the machine is working very slow or has loud fans, use a program like hwmonitor to check voltage, amperage, and temperature sensors and look for something that doesn’t look right..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2012 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Very slow, fan spins normally
threads.message:
Hello,
I have this board which had originally a short on <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>. I injected 3.4V on L6995, put alcohol everywhere and found an issue with <CHIP>U6400</CHIP>. For the moment I only removed L6400, I don't have a spare to replace <CHIP>U6400</CHIP> yet.
Now the board boots, internal display is ok, but very very slow to boot and to work. No battery installed. Activity monitor shows 89% used by the system.
In safe mode: same story, even more slow if possible, Activity monitor shows 95% used by the system.
PRAM reset: no changes
ASD OS: Passed
ASD EFI: Passed
I am almost sure that at a given moment with some SSD I saw <SIGNAL>KERNEL_TASK</SIGNAL> above 600%, but I am not able to reproduce that.
Hardware monitor: does not show high temperatures, fan is always around 2000rpm
I swapped memory, SSD, same story.
What could I do next?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2012 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Very slow, fan spins normally
threads.message: I’m guessing it behaves like this because of no battery. I had similar cases. Connect good battery and check again.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2012 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Very slow, fan spins normally
threads.message:
I tried your solution just to be sure, and... it worked!
I don't understand. I am now in front of another good working <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, same conditions without battery, and Activity monitor shows system use 1%!
Why?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2012 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Very slow, fan spins normally
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2012 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Very slow, fan spins normally
threads.message: Ok... no way to solve this? It works fine with battery, so that's all?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2012 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Very slow, fan spins normally
threads.message:
Yes, needs to have GOOD battery.
Crap chinese battery will not fix the problem.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2012 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Very slow, fan spins normally
threads.message: Ok, thank you both for your help.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2012 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Very slow, fan spins normally
threads.message: An update on this: installing Catalina updated the Boot ROM version from MBP91.00D7.B00 to 233.0.0.0.0 (with battery), and now I can remove the battery and the board works normally. In case in helps someone
